post_title: Good company if you want to retire but no chance for advancement. Everyone is too comfortable in here.
text: Pros: Opportunity to work on old aircrafts and work with experienced engineers. Stable job that doesn't fire employees. Exposure to many old aircrafts.. Cons: Poor management. Self centered management. Bad employees welfare. Alot of favoritism. 1 min ask employees to OT the next minute asking employees to take flexi/ annual leave. No chance for career advancement to management.

Pros: Job scope is alright when everything is in order. Good for stepping stone.. Cons: Lots of people keep pressuring you to do faster while you‚Äôre working alone handling a lot of tasks and no one is helping you. Forced to do OT everyday while our tasks are already finished. Toxic environment and lots of politics. No progression and no work life balance.
Pros: Medical and bonus ok ok ok. Cons: Low salary pay long hours
Pros: Stable Job and will not get retrenched. Cons: Pay is super low and growth is non existent if you have no connections.
Pros: The experience was good, with alot to learn. Cons: Location was quite far from town

post_title: Don't join unless you wanna to retire there
text: Pros: It is a place for retirement, and it is a place to train you, just like in army camp. Cons: Low salary, lousy management, messy workplace, little welfare benefit. Too many to say.

Pros: Staff from all walks of life, many of them mean well and are friendly / easy to work with. Cons: Inflexible HR personnel who are unable or unwilling to do anything that is not directly stated in their SOP. Favoritism from management to select staff which also results in an unbalanced working environment. Middle management tends to hide or butter up things when reporting to the top. Enforcement of "flexi-time" when there is no work available or when project managers want to download men. This so called flexi time means you are forced to go on leave but have to pay the company back with your overtime.

Pros: Nothing good if u work under system. Nothing I can think of seriously. Good if u are old and experience. Cons: A lot of politics, carry balls, If you had a Malay boss, good luck to u. Expect u to know everything, not for fresh graduate

Pros: Decent pay and employee benefits. Cons: Poor leadership at nearly all senior levels. Virtually no communication between senior management and shop personnel. No clear strategic vision. Micro-management by site leader and corporate office. Employees are treated as "units of production" rather than as stakeholders in the company.
